title: Amanda Holden laughs off fashion mishap ahead of Britain’s Got Talent: The Champions final
text:
Amanda Holden laughed off an awkward fashion moment (Picture: Splash)

Amanda Holden managed to laugh off an awkward fashion mishap as she headed out in London, this morning.

The Britain’s Got Talent judge looked seriously chic as she left the Heart Radio studios, following her breakfast show.

She opted for a mint green jumper for the day, paired with a bottle green, pleated skirt.

Clearly still in holiday mode, the 48-year-old completed the look with sunglasses and off-white trainers.

Without her coat, Amanda looked as if she felt the plummeting temperatures on her way out.

But she didn’t seem that fussed about the wardrobe faux-pas, choosing to laugh the whole thing off like a total pro.

Amanda Holden was the definition of chic in London (Picture: Backgrid)

She laughed off the mishap on Instagram (Picture: Backgrid)

Taking to Instagram, she even took a second to laugh at another mishap, sharing the moment she was caught ‘sorting her lady stuff’ out ahead of a photo.

Alongside the boomerang, showing her fiddling under her skirt, she joked: ‘When @sofialever thinks it hilarious to capture me sorting lady stuff out for my photo. @thisisheart #breakfast.’

Like her social media handle suggests, she definitely isn’t ‘Holden back’.

Amanda previously opened up about some of her fashion choices, after her bold Britain’s Got Talent looks attracted numerous complaints from viewers.

Side note: She always looks incredible.

But she’s taken the whole thing with a pinch of salt, insisting she will dress however she sees fit.

‘[Mum] said, “Ooh, let them talk. You look better than girls half your age”,’ she said the Mirror.

‘When she was 48 she wouldn’t have dared wear a mini skirt, because she’s of the era where you wouldn’t dare get your knees out if you were nearly 50.

‘Whereas I look at Kylie and J-Lo and think, well if she’s still doing it, I’m still doing it.’

Amanda also revealed daughters Hollie and Alexa love her fashion choices, telling OK! Magazine: ‘My children don’t bat an eyelid at what I wear and love borrowing my clothes. I have fun on Britain’s Got Talent – it’s the perfect opportunity to take risks.

‘Times have changed and I don’t feel anyone should feel pressure to dress for your age. It’s all about body positivity and feeling good.’

‘I treat clothing as armour so I can go out and face the world and battle each day. If you feel good in what you’re wearing then you’ll shine brightly.’

You tell ‘em, hun!
